snippet: A dispute over redrawn voting maps appeared to frustrate some members of the Supreme Court against the backdrop of looming deadlines.
abstract: Several members of the Supreme Court appear frustrated by limited options and looming deadlines in voting rights case from Texas in which they must choose between two sets of electoral maps, one drawn by the Legislature and one by a three-judge panel, or instruct lower courts how to do so; legal question for the court is how to treat maps drawn by legislatures in states with a history of discrimination; maps pertain to redistricting for Legislature and House of Representatives.
lead_paragraph: A dispute over redrawn voting maps appeared to frustrate some members of the Supreme Court against the backdrop of looming deadlines.

headline.seo: Texas Voting Rights Case Heard by Supreme Court
headline.main: Justices Grapple With Voting Rights Case That Could Help Tip the House
headline.print_headline: Justices Grapple With Voting Rights Case That Could Help Tip the House
